entries.text:
2026-02-14:
- Japanese B1 available (not A/B anymore) from all languages except BN, HI, TA, TE
- Moved to "old 2024-25" table:
 JA from all 130 A2

2026-02-10:
- Chinese B1 available (not A/B anymore) from all languages except BN, HI, TA, TE
- PlayerVsPlayer available to all in Chess (Android & IOS)
- Number of Stories and Radios updated in almost all core courses.
- Moved to "old 2024-25" table:
 ZH from all 130 A2

2026-02-09:
- Correction: B1 ZH, JA & KO are NOT yet available A/B, from BN, HI, TA, TE.
- Correction: The new German B1 from english is NOT yet available as A/B.
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since 2025 June 23).

2026-02-04:
- Korean B1 available from all languages as A/B (before as predicted)
- German B1 available (not A/B anymore) from all languages except English (Still A/B)
- Moved to "old 2024-25" table:
 DE from all 130 A2

2026-01-31:
- Japanese B1 available from all languages as A/B (before as predicted)
 Now, the expected release dates change slightly:
 Italian and Portuguese B1: second half of February
 Korean B1: first half of March
 German B2: second half of March
 Italian and Portuguese B2: first half of April 2026
 Chinese, Japanese, Korean B2: second half of April 2026

2026-01-29:
- Chinese B1 available from all languages as A/B (as predicted)
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since 2025/06/23).

2026-01-26:
- It seems that the definitive version of the Italian from English course will be the 130-units one.
 Both versions, the 123-unit and the 130-unit courses, reach A2 level, and Duolingo had not yet decided which one would be final.
 As a result, the older version has been marked in grey in the table.
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since 2025/06/23).

2026-01-23:
- German B1 from English was released due to human error and was not yet finished, so it has been withdrawn.
 Italian B1 is almost complete, as is Japanese B1, but the expected release dates remain unchanged.
- DE from EN 913 is shown in grey in the table until it's officially released.

2026-01-20:
- It seems Duolingo has changed its mind:
 First, B1 will be released, followed later by B2.
 In that case, the expected release dates change slightly:
 Chinese B1: first half of February
 German B2: second half of February
 Italian and Portuguese B1: first half of March
 Japanese, Korean B1: second half of March
 Italian and Portuguese B2: first half of April 2026
 Chinese, Japanese, Korean B2: second half of April 2026

2026-01-19:
 News coming from Tony K:
- German B1 available from many languages as A/B
- Removed from the table: ES B2 from TL, TA, TE, VI and FR from HI, TL, TA, TE, VI (Not expected to be released soon).

2026-01-18:
- Removed the "JSON" files in the "from" column. People who may need it, already know how to extract it directly from Duolingo...
- Estimated release dates:
 German B2: second half of February 2026
 Italian and Portuguese B2: first half of April 2026
 Chinese, Japanese, Korean B2: second half of April 2026
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since 2025/06/23).

2026-01-12:
- Spanish B2 available (no A/B anymore) from all languages except Tagalog, Tamil, Telugu and Vietnamese
- I forgot to mention PT update to B2! It will be updated at same time as Italian.
- Moved to "old 2024-25" table:
 Spanish (A2).

2025-12-29:
 Let's see if Duolingo release something interesting today or this week!
- French B2 available (no A/B anymore) from all languages except Hindi, Tagalog, Tamil, Telugu and Vietnamese
- Moved to "old 2024-25" table:
 English (less than 970 units), French (129), German (156), Spanish (286).

2025-12-18:
- Correction: French B2 is NOT yet available A/B, from HI, TL, TA, TE, VI.
- Correction: Spanish B2 is NOT yet available A/B, from TL, TA, TE, VI.
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since June 23).

2025-12-12:
- Added "Max Score" 2nd column (#)

2025-12-10:
- Filling the table with the new B2 Spanish
- Checking/updating number of Radios, Stories, Lessons...

2025-12-09:
- Spanish B2 available from all languages as A/B
- I'll be adding all data to the table throughout this week.
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since June 23).

2025-12-08:
- Filling the table with the new B2 French
- Checking/updating number of Radios, Stories, Lessons...

2025-12-03:
- Added "MaxScore" in the Course Info link (1st column)
- Corrected: VI from EN is labelled as A1 and not A2

2025-12-01:
- French B2 available from all languages as A/B
- Stories in many core courses are now definitive (not A/B anymore)
- I'll be adding all data to the table throughout this week.

2025-11-29:
- Added all "x5" courses

2025-11-28:
- Added "x5" EN from TE, TH, VI, UK

2025-11-27:
- Added "x5" EN from DE & IT
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since June 23).

2025-11-22:
- Added "x5" EN from AR & TR
- Moved to "old 2024-25" table:
 JA from ZH 110

2025-11-20:
- A rare and curious piece of news: Duolingo's China team is developing a Shanghainese course from Mandarin Chinese.
 Back in September I spotted the first hints of it, but I didn't dare publish anything. Now it seems clear that the course is indeed in active development.
 In the code, only a single reference (a temporary internal tag) appeared, but now we can find more sources to confirm its existence.

2025-11-15:
- Duolingo is moving very fast on its CEFR B2 expansions for all its courses.
 French and Spanish are already finished and are just waiting for final tweaks. They're expected to go into A/B testing in early December.
 German, Italian, and Portuguese seem to be next, likely launching at the end of December.
 Finally, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean are planned for release in January 2026, or February at the latest.

2025-11-12:
- Adding the weird "x5 units" courses to the table: EN from ES

2025-11-10:
- Corrected: JA from EN has 29 stories (not 30)
 Apparently, "Family Dinner" included "Wine" in the story, so it was removed
 Thanks to Resubaroso (H.Cabrera) for the correction!!!

2025-11-09:
- Adding the weird "x5 units" courses to the table: EN from JA, EN from KO

2025-11-08:
- Duolingo is adding AI generated stories to some core courses in A/B tests.
 Also, they add/modify/remove radios.

2025-11-07:
- Adding the weird "x5 units" courses to the table: DE from EN

2025-11-06:
- Adding the weird "x5 units" courses to the table: EN from EN

2025-11-05:
- Adding the weird "x5 units" courses to the table, now FR from EN
- Moved to "old 2024-25" table:
 KO from EN 70, 112
 ZH, JA, KO A1

2025-11-03:
- Adding the weird "x5 units" courses to the table, starting with ES from EN
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since June 23).

2025-10-30:
- ZH, JA, KO 4th section (A2) available to everyone (not A/B anymore)

2025-10-17:
- Slowly filling data in table for new A2 expansions...

2025-10-15:
- Slowly filling data in table for new A2 expansions...
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since June 23).

2025-10-11:
- DE 4th section (A2) available to everyone (not A/B anymore)
- Moved to "old 2024-25" table:
 DE from FR 117 units A2
 DE from RU 111 units A2
 DE from all 70 units A1
- Slowly filling data in table for new A2 expansions...

2025-10-10:
- DE from AR 120 (A2) moved to "2024-2025 Table"
- Slowly filling data in table for new A2 expansions...

2025-10-08:
- This section, "Daily Duolingo News", is now in HTML format, as is the monthly "News".
- Slowly filling data in table for new A2 expansions...

2025-10-06:
- ZH, JA and KO 4th section (60 units, CEFR A2) launched as A/B from many languages (as predicted).
- Adding/Checking course data from:
 EL, HI, HU
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since June 23).
- Minor cosmetic changes (headers)

2025-10-05:
- Adding/Checking course data from:
 ID, PL, PT

2025-10-03:
- Adding/Checking course data from:
 RO, RU, SV, TL, TA

2025-10-02:
- Adding/Checking course data from:
 TE, TH, UK, VI, DE, IT, JA, KO
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since June 23).

2025-09-30:
- The expansion of Asian languages up to A2 level (Section 4, 60 units) is ready to be launched, but its release has been delayed until (hopefully) this October.
- So: ZH, JA, KO 130 units release date changed to 25.10

2025-09-27:
- PT 71 and IT 70 (A1) moved to "2024-2025 Table"
- JA from EN 221 v1 moved to "2024-2025 Table"
- PT from EN 91 moved to "2024-2025 Table"
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since June 23).

2025-09-26:
- PT & IT 4th section (A2) available to everyone (not A/B anymore)
(I will try to fill the table this week!)

2025-09-20:
- Added DE & PT from IT A2, DE & IT from JA A2
- "Number of learners" NOT updated by Duolingo (Since June 23).

2025-09-15:
- Added DE from KO A2

2025-09-14:
- Added IT & PT from KO A2
- There is no clue, absolutely none, that Duolingo works, has worked, or will work at levels above B2.
- On the other hand, there are multiple references to extensions "up to B2" for its nine main courses: Chinese, English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Spanish.
